comments: He was a great professor. He plays music before every class. If you miss class, notes are up on Carmen. He\'s very understanding when it comes to certain things and great to have a conversation with. You can really tell he\'s excited about teaching and history is one of his favorite subjects. Debates in class were one of my favorite things we did.

He is an extremely helpful professor, and he finds ways to make history more interesting than teachers I\'ve had in the past. I think he\'s great, and I\'m actually taking 152 with him next quarter! Two autobiographies to read, textbook is optional. I passed the class without the book. Two exams, Two short papers.

Professor Kennedy kept the class interesting and really understands history and how to make it appealing to college students. He does clear his throat quite a bit though and has a Boston accent but once past that, he is easy to understand. Lots of reading but class discussions really help for clarity. Definitely recommend him.
Great professor. Presented his material in a very engaging way and kept things interesting

He is clears his throat alot during lecture, which was annoying in the beginning, but I got used to it. His class is really easy, except for the mult choice exams which have trick questions on them. You will learn alot and do alot of discussing during class.
